name: grotesque
content:
grotesque adjective
(UGLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
strange and unpleasant, especially in a silly or slightly frightening way: By now she'd had so much cosmetic surgery that she looked quite grotesque. Gothic churches are full of devils and grotesque figures. Synonyms
ghastly UK informal
grim (UNPLEASANT) informal
hideous
ugly (NOT ATTRACTIVE)
unattractive
unprepossessing
unsightly formal
More examplesFewer examplesThe performers wear grotesque masks.The sculpture was hideously grotesque.They shared comically grotesque stories of their experiences.

grotesque adjective
(WRONG)
wrong or unfair to a shocking degree: This war has been a grotesque mistake. The way he behaved towards me was grotesque.
More examplesFewer examplesThis was a grotesque injustice.This proposal is so bizarre and grotesque that I cannot imagine who would support it.There is something grotesque about exploiting her husband's terrible injuries for cash.
